title: ODI Summit: How did we get here? - panel

details.description:
Bill Thompson, of the BBC, poses the question, "This is our beautiful web, these are our beautiful datasets. How did we get here?" to a panel, including;

Sir Tim Berners-Lee (President & Founder – Open Data Institute) Sir Nigel Shadbolt (Chairman – Open Data Institute) Beth Noveck (The Governance Lab – NYU) Chaired by Bill Thompson (BBC)

details.alternative_title: A fireside chat, featuring Beth Novek, Sir Tim Berners-Lee, Sir Nigel Shadbolt. Chaired by Bill Thompson of the BBC.
details.content:
Bill Thompson, of the BBC, poses the question, "This is our beautiful web, these are our beautiful datasets. How did we get here?" to a panel, including;

  • Sir Tim Berners-Lee (President & Founder – Open Data Institute)
  • Sir Nigel Shadbolt (Chairman – Open Data Institute)
  • Beth Noveck (The Governance Lab – NYU)
  • Chaired by Bill Thompson (BBC)

The ODI Annual Summit was held on Tuesday 29th October 2013 in the Museum of London. Featuring high-profile speakers, open data luminaries and leading thinkers from business, government, technology and start-ups. The summit brought together an international line-up of acclaimed experts including world wide web inventor and ODI founder Sir Tim Berners-Lee. The summit was hosted by co-founder and chair Sir Nigel Shadbolt and CEO Gavin Starks.
